page.title: 08Newcastle Byker; Employment
page.content: In a survey of Raby Street school we found that parents are mostly }unemployed. Most employed people are cleaners. The manpower intelligence unit told us that Newcastle 60,000 people are shopworkers, 45,000 are fitters. The other most popular jobs were nurses, shorthand typists, teachers and lorry and van drivers. The geatest employment was people who work in shops. Employment has changed because there used to be shipyards and rail tracks by the Tyne but now there are fewer jobs there. The big factories for flour making and other things are closing down. New machinery has caused redundancy because fewer people are needed to run it.
